item.title: Data Visualization with R - Box Plots
item.description: This is the sixth post in the series Data Visualization With R. In the previous post, we learnt how to build bar plots. In this post, we will learn about box plots. Introduction The box plot is a standardized way of displaying the distribution of data based on the five number summary: minimum, first quartile, median, third quartile, and maximum. Box plots are useful for detecting outliers and for comparing distributions.
